  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 27

Words 2601-2700

  1. suspect
    The police suspect him of stealing the money.

  2. swear
    I swear I will never lie to you again.

  3. sweater
    She wore a warm sweater on the cold day.

  4. sweep
    Please sweep the floor before the guests arrive.

  5. sweet
    The cake was very sweet and delicious.

  6. swim
    They love to swim in the lake during summer.

  7. swimming
    Swimming is a great way to stay healthy.

  8. switch
    Can you switch off the light before leaving?

  9. symbol
    The heart is a symbol of love.

  10. sympathy
    She showed great sympathy for the injured man.

  11. symptom
    A fever is a common symptom of the flu.

  12. system
    The new system will make the process faster.

  13. table
    The books are on the table in the living room.

  14. tablet
    He bought a new tablet to read books online.

  15. tail
    The dog wagged its tail happily.

  16. take
    Please take this book to your teacher.

  17. tale
    The old man told a tale about his adventures.

  18. talent
    She has a talent for playing the piano.

  19. talented
    He is a talented artist who paints beautiful pictures.

  20. talk
    They like to talk about their favorite movies.

  21. tall
    The tall tree in the garden gives a lot of shade.

  22. tank
    The fish are swimming in the water tank.

  23. tape
    Use this tape to fix the broken paper.

  24. target
    The team worked hard to reach their target.

  25. task
    Cleaning the house is a difficult task.

  26. taste
    The soup has a very good taste.

  27. tax
    Everyone must pay tax on their income.

  28. taxi
    We took a taxi to the train station.

  29. tea
    She drinks a cup of tea every morning.

  30. teach
    He loves to teach children how to read.

  31. teacher
    The teacher explained the lesson clearly.

  32. teaching
    Teaching is a rewarding profession.

  33. team
    Our team won the football match yesterday.

  34. tear1
    A tear rolled down her cheek as she said goodbye.

  35. tear2
    Be careful not to tear the paper while opening it.

  36. technical
    The technical problem delayed the project.

  37. technique
    She learned a new technique for solving the puzzle.

  38. technology
    Modern technology has made life easier.

  39. teenage
    Teenage years are full of challenges and growth.

  40. teenager
    The teenager spent the afternoon playing video games.

  41. telephone
    She called her friend on the telephone.

  42. television
    They watched a movie on television last night.

  43. tell
    Can you tell me the way to the nearest shop?

  44. temperature
    The temperature dropped below freezing last night.

  45. temporary
    This is just a temporary solution to the problem.

  46. ten
    There are ten apples in the basket.

  47. tend
    She tends to forget things when she is busy.

  48. tennis
    They played tennis at the sports club.

  49. tent
    We set up a tent in the forest for camping.

  50. term
    The term “global warming” is often used in discussions about climate change.

  51. terrible
    The weather was terrible during their trip.

  52. test
    He studied hard for the math test.

  53. text
    She sent a text message to her friend.

  54. than
    He is taller than his brother.

  55. thank
    I want to thank you for your help.

  56. thanks
    Thanks for the wonderful gift!

  57. that
    That is the book I was looking for.

  58. the
    The sun is shining brightly today.

  59. theatre
    They went to the theatre to watch a play.

  60. their
    Their house is at the end of the street.

  61. theirs
    The car parked outside is theirs.

  62. them
    I saw them at the park this morning.

  63. theme
    The theme of the story is about friendship.

  64. themselves
    They built the house themselves without any help.

  65. then
    We had lunch and then went for a walk.

  66. theory
    His theory about the problem was correct.

  67. therapy
    She is undergoing therapy to recover from the injury.

  68. there
    There is a beautiful garden behind the house.

  69. therefore
    He was late, therefore he missed the meeting.

  70. they
    They are planning to visit the museum tomorrow.

  71. thick
    The book has very thick pages.

  72. thief
    The thief was caught by the police.

  73. thin
    She prefers thin slices of bread for her sandwich.

  74. thing
    The most important thing is to stay calm.

  75. think
    I think we should leave early to avoid traffic.

  76. thinking
    He spent the evening thinking about his future.

  77. third
    She finished third in the race.

  78. thirsty
    After the long walk, he felt very thirsty.

  79. thirteen
    There are thirteen students in the class.

  80. thirty
    The meeting will start at thirty minutes past two.

  81. this
    This is the best day of my life.

  82. though
    He stayed calm, though he was very angry.

  83. thought
    She had a sudden thought about the solution.

  84. thousand
    There were a thousand people at the concert.

  85. threat
    The storm is a serious threat to the small village.

  86. threaten
    The dark clouds threaten to bring heavy rain.

  87. three
    They have three children in their family.

  88. throat
    His throat hurt after shouting for so long.

  89. through
    They walked through the forest to reach the lake.

  90. throughout
    The festival is celebrated throughout the country.

  91. throw
    Please throw the ball to me.

  92. Thursday
    We have a meeting scheduled for Thursday.

  93. thus
    He worked hard, thus achieving great success.

  94. ticket
    She bought a ticket for the concert.

  95. tidy
    Please keep your room tidy and clean.

  96. tie
    He wore a red tie with his suit.

  97. tight
    The lid on the jar is very tight and hard to open.

  98. till
    We waited till the rain stopped.

  99. time
    What time does the train arrive?

  100. tin
    She opened a tin of soup for dinner.
